column5: Just to let every-one know with the extreme cold we are getting in the next few days this weekend will be a go. But still stay away from current areas. I do have a huge amount of minnows on hand , all the jigs required for the area , portable ice huts , spuds , vexlars , foot treads and on and on. You can probably name it and I got it. The most asked question I get is do I have licenses. Yep you bet. I have both resident and non-resident. Have fun be safe and bring back everything you took with you, Ron
Thanks for the info. Now who are you?
So what's the word on the actual walleye bite?
Another Question....What area are you fishing?
I am guessing he is a tackle and bait shop near the Bay of Quinte!
Could be anywhere! Bet the ice-fishing is awesome in Nunavut...    Mike

thanks ron,and yes guys he does own a tackle shop and is very knwlagable about the bat and he is in bellville i believe,so i guess you will be busy this weekend ron,maybe see you dwn there very soon....getting cabin fever if ya know what i mean....
Well, at least the Rednecks are payin' attention!  ... and those Walleyes look zackerly like Pickerals to me!!!
